title: Problem Overview
content: Erdos Problem #884: Is the all-pairs divisor gap sum bounded by the consecutive-pairs sum? Status: OPEN.
mathContext: For divisors d_1 < ... < d_t of n, compare sum_{i<j} 1/(d_j-d_i) with 1 + sum_i 1/(d_{i+1}-d_i).

title: Divisor Lists
content: divisorList(n): sorted list of divisors. numDivisors(n) = tau(n). divisor(n,i): i-th divisor.
mathContext: The divisors of n form a finite set; sorting gives d_1 < d_2 < ... < d_t.

title: Divisor Gaps
content: consecutiveGap(n,i) := d_{i+1} - d_i. generalGap(n,i,j) := d_j - d_i for i < j.
mathContext: Consecutive gaps are the basic building blocks; general gaps are sums of consecutive ones.

title: The Two Sums
mathContext: All-pairs has O(tau^2) terms; consecutive-pairs has O(tau) terms. The conjecture compares them.

title: Main Conjecture
content: ErdosConjecture884: exists C > 0 such that allPairsSum(n) <= C * (1 + consecutivePairsSum(n)) for all n > 1.
mathContext: The central question: is the all-pairs sum controlled by consecutive-pairs sum with absolute constant?

title: Basic Properties
content: allPairsSum_nonneg, consecutivePairsSum_nonneg. All-pairs has C(tau,2) terms, consecutive has tau-1 terms.
mathContext: Both sums are non-negative since gaps are positive. The number of terms differs quadratically.

title: Examples
content: n=6: divisors [1,2,3,6], consecutive sum 2.33, all-pairs sum 3.28. Prime p: both sums equal 1/(p-1).
mathContext: For primes the conjecture holds with equality. For composites the ratio varies.

title: Telescoping Intuition
content: d_j - d_i = sum of consecutive gaps. So 1/(d_j-d_i) <= 1/(max consecutive gap involved).
mathContext: Consecutive gaps form a natural basis. General gaps are sums, hence larger.

title: Connection to Problem 144
content: divisorHarmonicSum(n) = sum_{d|n} 1/d. Problem 144 studies Egyptian fractions with divisor denominators.
mathContext: Both problems study arithmetic of divisor sets, connecting to Egyptian fraction representations.

title: Multiplicative Structure
content: numDivisors_mul_coprime: tau(mn) = tau(m)*tau(n) for coprime m,n. Highly composite numbers are test cases.
mathContext: The multiplicative structure of tau affects gap patterns; HCNs maximize divisor count.

title: Problem Status
content: The problem is OPEN. erdos_884_statement: formal version of the conjecture.
mathContext: The question of whether all-pairs is bounded by consecutive-pairs remains unresolved.
